author: larde.victor
title: Ubuntu - One Small Town Ecosystem
description: Cardano's decentralization mission cannot be successful without the support of small integrated communities worldwide sharing common goals.

f6_assessments.q0: The team described the plan in a clear and understandable way. The team researched and analyzed the solution in detail and the logic that impacts the challenge. The proposal is an ecosystem development from a small town, but with a big worldwide impact. Expanding the Cardano community network. The proposal also provides some solutions to the risks when the project is implemented. From the plan laid out, I believe in the strong success of the project.
f6_assessments.q1: The plan is detailed and clear with each important milestone. Reasonable and transparent budget is broken down and detailed according to each stage of work and established time. Together with a team of highly skilled researchers and developers with many years of experience in the field, it strengthens the success of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: A clear, coherent plan easily measures the success of the project. Funds are divided into reasonable, transparent determination of the scheme. I look forward to the success of the project because of the deep experience from fund 7

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposers have described clearly their solution - One Small Town which includes 6 major projects. Each project is indicated with related information including its features, goals, target audience, and what the team will do in its operation process. These projects have been expected to address the current challenge and eventually attract more users to the Cardano ecosystem. They divide the One Small Town Global Office implementation into different phases and update the status of the completed phase. This enables the community to easily track the progress and see what’s done, thereby assessing the whole process. 
They have properly predicted the main challenges during the project’s duration. All possible steps that need to be taken to mitigate these risks are clarified. Achieving these steps, the team will be able to ensure smooth workflows and optimize their execution process. This risk management also helps to increase the project‘s reliability and keep the community engaged in.
f6_assessments.q1:
The timeline of the project is in compliance with their development orientations. There will be main activities that need to be accomplished in each quarter. A small recommendation of mine is that they can discuss how they gonna get these main tasks done by providing the relevant subtasks together with the staff who are responsible. This detailed breakdown will help both the proposer team and the community easily follow and detect any delay that might happen. 
The budget has been effectively broken down and well-aligned with its delivery plan. The community can see that most of the budget goes to the staffing cost. The information is very clear and adequate in case there is a need for a later double-check. The community can use it to better evaluate the effectiveness of their financial allocations.
The information about the members of the team is concisely provided. They have covered their names, positions as well as LinkedIn accounts for further looking into working experiences and past activities. By viewing this information, the community can have a solid base to examine the team’s ability in general and each individual’s in particular.
f6_assessments.q2:
For each project mentioned in the beginning, there will be specific ways to measure the progress and the development. Every necessary indicator, which is closely linked with their deliverables, has been set for the measurement process, allowing the community to have a clear view of their performance.
The promising results are expected after launching the project. These clear goals will help them keep the project on track and shift their focus on the key areas. The community can use their vision of success as a base to assess their effectiveness and impacts.

f6_assessments.q0: In this section, you have presented all the contents that a proposal should have. You describe in great detail the vision you will develop in the future with One Small Town. All information is not only provided but also explained very carefully. The completion of phase 1 will help the project have a basis for further development. Moreover, this project will certainly bring a lot of value to Cardano. Besides, risks are inevitable like other projects. You also covered some of the risks and challenges your project may face in this section.
f6_assessments.q1: Your roadmap is allocated quarterly quite reasonably. Through your introduction about the team members, I feel that they are extremely reliable and will contribute to the success of the project. Detailed budgets are also analyzed in detail in this section.
f6_assessments.q2: The picture of the success of the project is described in great detail by you. It is very attractive to me. I am very much looking forward to the success of the project. In particular, the partnership with Cardano is what impressed me. The related proposals you provide at the end of the proposal are also a good foundation for the project and greatly increase the feasibility of the project. If possible please let me know where the whole process and progress of the project will be made public and reported? What platform can investors follow this project? If you mention this in more detail, your proposal would be perfect.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is clear. "Cardano's decentralization mission cannot be successful without the support of small integrated communities worldwide sharing common goals." However, the problem solution; "To partner with One Small Town is to open Cardano's network to many communities, from more than 140 countries across all continents." is open for interpretation, and I believe the cardano community is already much larger and more successful than the One Small Town community. The implication is that Cardano cannot be successful without the support of One Small Town initiative. I believe this proposal would benefit the One Small Town community more so than the Cardano Community. With only 12000 Facebook likes on the proposers organizations page, it's not clear that this organization has a global reach or significantly large community of supporters. The challenge question is "What applications will provide the most value for end users in 2022?" and It is unclear how providing $100,000 (for this proposal, of a total $392 000 needed) will provide the most value to cardano users. The proposal includes; "Phase 2 is to establish the Global Office as a profit centre." so it appears this funding will be used to allow the proposing team to create a for profit office to market their non-profit vision. It is claimed in the proposal:  "As we fully intent to be present again fund 9 and 10 of Catalyst, we can always ask again for more fund later this year. For this proposal, we aiming at 100 000$ to allow us to launch few stake pools, get ready for the ICO of our token, start the development of the tools…" so it is difficult to see how this money leaving the cardano ecosystem will come back into the cardano ecosystem and create value for ada holders, as the funds appear to be a source of profit for the One Small Town team. The KPI's are unclear, and do not clearly align with the catalyst challenge question.
f6_assessments.q1:
One of the promises of the One Small Town initiative, as described in one of the 5 proposals they submitted for fund 7 is "OST's regenerative economic system's competitive advantage is secured by our NRT : free green energy, clean water production and technology that removes toxic waste of legacy extraction operations." I have reviewed their proposal to potential town mayors here: https://www.onesmalltown.org/_files/ugd/81a8a7_4bb8ad4f5989460cba5af436dd225562.pdf
INSTALLATION OF OUR OWN ELECTRICITY SUPPLY (where possible)
One of the cornerstones of our plan.
UBUNTU Planet has a unique agreements with a group of scientists,
manufacturers, and technology partners with highly advanced technology to
generate clean, environmentally friendly, non-toxic and non-polluting electricity – NOT SOLAR ENERGY.
In Addition: This technology will process all sewage, converting it to clean structured and energised water, and clean non-toxic compost that can be use in our agriculture or sold on the open market.
Furthermore: Our energy technology has the capacity to clean-up rivers, dams and any other polluted areas and convert seawater to clean drinking water. This is particularly important for coastal towns and communities.
Toxic Waste: Our energy technology can also be used to discard and neutralise toxic waste and other hazardous materials from mines and hospitals. This presents a very lucrative income opportunity for the community and potential
investors."




As a CA with a background in sustainable energy, I find this claim extremely suspicious, and highly doubt that this "free energy" technology even exists. There is no information about it on their website, and no proof of it successfully operating. It is just a promise and a vision.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal does not include a clear timeline or auditable KPI's that can be evaluated by the community. 
There is no clear link between the proposers goals and the Catalyst challenge question that can be measured and audited. 
The proposer has submitted several proposals previously such as this one: https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/384293 that are built around an idea of free energy. 
I believe this One Small Town project is an elaborate scam that is selling a dream built around free energy technology that does not exist. Yes this may be considered a biased review, but after looking into this project I feel the Cardano community needs to be careful not to let these actors extract too much ada out of our ecosystem. We should not be funding OST stakepools that will create a constant selling pressure to fund their marketing campaigns. https://www.reddit.com/r/badarchaeology/comments/3gx8yy/hack_reviews_michael_tellinger/
